intro: Cacalia carnosa, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Cacalia carnosa is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
